history.content: From @11109, "I can tell you definitively that time conflicts with the lecture will NOT be allowed by Prof Hilfinger". So you can't really do this.

children.subject:
@student answer

If one section allows conflict, even if Prof. doesn't, I should be allowed to enroll; this is quite clear on several places online.

Anyways, I have followed up with several staff for now. Thanks!

history.content:
Now that 61B has expanded, I am trying to enroll in all my classes.

From @11109:

In response to the question about how time conflicts work - if you enroll into the class that doesn't allow time conflicts FIRST and then enroll into the class that allows time conflicts, you can then be enrolled in both. 

My two conflicting sections are 61B Lecture (no conflicts allowed) and 127 Discussion (yes conflicts allowed). Per the instructions, I attempted to enroll but was still given the error message:


Error: A scheduling conflict exists with a currently enrolled class 28165. The requested class is set to not allow any students to enroll in classes with time conflicts. 

For good measure, I tried enrolling the other order as well and was also given a similar error.

According to https://sis.berkeley.edu/help/enrollment-faq/time-conflict, if one class does allow time conflict, the system should allow registration after providing an initial warning message. Per the instructions, I have checked through schedule planner that 127 Discussion indeed allows conflicts.

How can I get this enrollment issue resolved or who should I contact to have my situation looked at, so I can finally finish enrollment?
history.subject: Time Conflict Enrollment Issue
